ComicInfo.Summary:
Doggo and Mode successfully pass off a piece of salvage junk as art.
Random is the word in this series of completely unconnected panels.
Mr. Snoid talks about his residence inside a woman's butt.
Mr. Natural, sick of the city, heads out west. While on the train, a lady who asks him to watch her baby never comes back.
A satirical paranoid rant from Crumb, as he suspects fumes from his ink bottle is actually poison gas planted by a government agent.
Crumb paints himself as being intensely sadistic in this satirical piece.
Crumb draws several different versions of himself.
On a whim, Crumb enrolls in the "National School of Hard Knocks" in order to get some professional training. He winds up getting more than he bargained for.
An H-bomb blows up Mr. Sketchum right after he mails some cartoons to Bertrand Russell.
